New Records: Giannis Antetokounmpo made NBA history with his 26th-straight game scoring at least 20 or more points on 50 percent shooting or better.
Key Match Events: A furious 20-0 rally in the final six and a half minutes put the Milwaukee Bucks in position to steal a second-straight game with a sizable second-half comeback.
With 23.1 seconds remaining, a challenge from coach Doc Rivers overturned a foul on Damian Lillard and gave the Bucks a chance to beat the Brooklyn Nets on the other end.
After Ziaire Williams made two free throws, the Bucks had a chance to tie the score and force overtime, but Damian Lillard missed a good look at a 3-pointer.
The Nets hung on and beat the Bucks 113-110.
Pre-Game Insights: Heading into the game, the Bucks knew the Nets were going to try to be physical on the ball defensively and try to force them into turnovers and poor execution.
Post-Match Reflections: Giannis Antetokounmpo expressed disappointment in missing key layups and emphasized the need for better focus and execution.
Coach Doc Rivers acknowledged the team's lack of preparation and focus against the Nets.
Antetokounmpo highlighted the need for the team to be more locked in and focused to avoid early deficits.
Antetokounmpo still believes the team is capable of building winning habits and competing at a high level.
